column9: i am 60 years old and i have been using lomotil for acute bouts of colotis which come on suddenly. i was given other drugs at first which did nothing. lomotil is a lifesaver. i dont have to worry about if i can take care of my grandson or if i can go out. it is the best thing invented for diarrhea. i have never felt the need to take it or want it after it stops my diarrhea so i dont know why it is said to be potentially habit forming. ive been taking it for close to 10 years and only when i need it. there are no side affects. i couldnt live a useful and productive life without. i recommend it to others who need it.

column2: neverwon, 55-64 on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)

column2: JennC, 25-34 Female  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: I was put on this medication to help treat my diarrhea predominant IBS.  It worked wonders and allowed me to have a somewhat normal life.  However after about 6yrs of using this medication.  I noticed that I had no energy amongst other issues, and I was clearly addicted to it.  I detoxed off of this medication, a week of hell.  Since coming of this medication I have been feeling a lot better, and my IBS actually is better now off the medication then when I was on it.  I would say to use this medication as a last resort, it does work for what its intended to do, but is highly addictive.

column2: 75 or over Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I found that taking Lomotil before mealswas most effective for me.

column2: 55-64 Male  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient)
column9: This drug allowed me to continue working as a classroom teacher.  After surgery for Crohn's over 30 years ago, I had severe and chronic diarrhea. I began taking Lomotil at that time. I wish they would deregulare its use.  The generic version is almost as expensive as the brand name, but it's worth the cost.  My doctor told me I was probably addicted, but I feel it's like insulin.  I need it to have a good quality of life.

column2: Milo, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 5 to less than 10 years (Patient)
column9: My (former) doctor first prescribed this for a bout of gastroenteritis, then gave me a prescription to take as needed for IBS with diarrhea. Extremely effective, with no notable side effects. Supposedly Imodium is just as effective, but not in my experience.

column2: 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I was on Lomotil for 1 1/2yrs. The dr started with 2/day. When I was taken off because it wasn't working at all, he had me taking 1500/per month - that equals 10 5x/day. When I changed RX stores, the new pharmists flipped out!!! He was the only one that seemed to be aware of the damage Atropine could do to ones eyesite.  And he was right.  When I was started on this med I had better than 20/20 vision. Now I can't see anything with out contacts or glasses on at any distance. Everything is very blurry ALL the time with out them.  And on top of that, my chronic diarrhea from medical resectioning did not improve at any doseage!  If you value your eyesite, please be careful.  Be sure you have regular vision checks so you'll be aware if its changing and can make adjustments.  Although, by that time you may be to late, like I was.

column2: solo6916, 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
